definition: to roam all over the place/to go into every nook and corner/to infiltrate/(of criminals, enemies etc) to be on the run/to flee and try to hide
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
to flee/to scuttle/to exile or banish/to amend or edit

sentences.english: Chinese crackdown led the Dalai Lama to flee into exile in India in 1959.
sentences.chinese: 中國的打擊使達賴在1959年流竄到了印度。

sentences.english: He was believed to have altered his appearance and traveled throughout Europe, Mexico, Canada and the United States.
sentences.chinese: 他改頭換面後流竄到過歐洲，墨西哥，加拿大和美國。

sentences.english: All my best fish recipes, from Big Mike and Tater .
sentences.chinese: 我所有的最好的魚食譜，從大麥克和流竄。

sentences.english: Left to raise themselves on the streets, these children form roving bands of delinquents.
sentences.chinese: 這些孩子被迫流浪街頭，結成了一些流竄的犯罪團伙。

sentences.english: Does it run in your blood to betray the ones you love?
sentences.chinese: 那些事流竄在你血液中讓你去背叛你所愛的人嗎？

sentences.english: I looked into his eyes still clinging onto a life that was quickly departing.
sentences.chinese: 我探入他的眼，看著他緊抓的生命流竄散逸。
